key_events.description: Board approved a capital increase of R$ 12,846,837,880.00 on December 18, 2025, raising it from R$ 124,063,060,190.00 to R$ 136,909,898,070.00.
Shareholders can transfer fractions of bonus shares from January 2, 2026, to February 2, 2026, with a cost of R$ 40.00 per share.
Itaú (ITUB4) will present its 4T25 results after market close on February 4, 2026.
Itaú BBA forecasts M&A may increase by 10% in 2026.
Goldman Sachs maintains a buy recommendation for Itaú, projecting credit growth of around 9.5% per year for Brazilian banks in 2026.

risk_factors: Market caution at the beginning of 2026 leading to price consolidation.

investment_thesis.bull_case: Positive M&A outlook with a potential increase of 10% in 2026, according to Itaú BBA. Goldman Sachs maintains a buy recommendation, projecting credit growth of 9.5% for Brazilian banks in 2026. ITUB3's dividend yield is 11.05%.
investment_thesis.bear_case: Market is more cautious at the beginning of 2026, leading to price consolidation. BBAS3 iniciou 2026 em baixa, com recuo de 3,28% no ano.

summary_markdown: Itaú Unibanco (ITUB3) shows mixed signals. The Board approved a capital increase of R$ 12,846,837,880.00 on December 18, 2025. JCP payments of R$0.01818200 per share were made throughout 2026. Goldman Sachs maintains a buy recommendation with projected credit growth of 9.5% for Brazilian banks in 2026. Itaú BBA forecasts M&A may increase by 10% in 2026. ITUB3's dividend yield is 11.05%. However, the market is more cautious at the beginning of 2026, leading to price consolidation.
